dialog.Sahwit: I was going door-to-door, sellin: witness 1: I was going door-to-door selling magazine subscriptions when I spotted a man running out of an apartment.
dialog.Sahwit: I thought he must be in a hurry: witness 1: I assumed he must have been in a rush because he left the door partially open.
dialog.Sahwit: Thinking it strange, I looked in: witness 1: Finding it odd, I decided to peek inside the apartment.
dialog.Sahwit: Then I saw her lying there... A: witness 1: That's when I saw her... a woman... lying still... dead!
dialog.Sahwit: I quailed in fright and found my: witness 1: I froze in terror and couldn't bring myself to step inside.
dialog.Sahwit: I thought to call the police imm: witness 1: I immediately thought to contact the police!
dialog.Sahwit: However, the phone in her apartm: witness 1: But the phone inside the apartment wasn't working.
dialog.Sahwit: I went to a nearby park and foun: witness 1: So I hurried to a nearby park where there was a public telephone.
dialog.Sahwit: I remember the time exactly: It: witness 1: I clearly remember the time: it was exactly 1:00 PM.
dialog.Sahwit: The man who ran was, without a d: witness 1: And the man who fled was, without a doubt, the defendant sitting right over there.
dialog.Sahwit: You see, when I found the body,: witness 1: Look, I heard the time when I discovered the body.
dialog.Sahwit: There was a voice saying the tim: witness 1: A voice announced the time... Likely from the TV.
dialog.Sahwit: Oh, but it was three hours off,: witness 1: Ah, but there was a three-hour discrepancy, correct?
dialog.Sahwit: I guess the victim must have bee: witness 1: I suppose the victim 1 was viewing a recorded video!
dialog.Sahwit: That's why I thought it was 1:00: witness 1: That explains why I believed it was 1:00 PM!
dialog.Sahwit: Terribly sorry about the misunde: witness 1: My apologies for the confusion...
dialog.Sahwit: Actually, I didn't \"hear\" the: witness 1: Actually, I didn't 'hear' the time... I observed it!
dialog.Sahwit: There was a table clock in the a: witness 1: There was a desk clock in the apartment, correct!
dialog.Sahwit: Yeah, the murder weapon! The kil: witness 1: Yes, the murder weapon! The killer 1 struck the victim 1 with it!
witness 1: That must be what I observed.

dialog.Gumshoe: As soon as the phone call came: detective 1: I proceeded to the scene immediately upon receiving the call!
dialog.Gumshoe: There were two people there alr: detective 1: Two individuals were already present:
dialog.Gumshoe: The defendant, Ms. Maya Fey, an: detective 1: The defendant 1, and the lawyer 1.
dialog.Gumshoe: Why? We had a witness account d: detective 1: The reason? We had a witness statement identifying her!
dialog.Gumshoe: The witness saw Ms. Maya Fey at: detective 1: The witness observed defendant 1 precisely when the murder occurred!
dialog.Gumshoe: After securing the suspect, I e: detective 1: After securing the suspect, I personally examined the crime scene.
dialog.Gumshoe: I found a memo written on a pie: detective 1: I discovered a note written on paper beside the victim's body!
dialog.Gumshoe: On it, the word \"Maya\" was wr: detective 1: On it, the name "defendant 1" was clearly written in blood!
dialog.Gumshoe: Lab test results showed that th: detective 1: Laboratory analysis confirmed the blood belonged to the victim!
dialog.Gumshoe: Also, there was blood found on: detective 1: Additionally, blood was found on the victim's finger!
dialog.Gumshoe: Before she died, the victim wro: detective 1: Before dying, the victim wrote the name of the killer!
dialog.Gumshoe: How you like that? That's my \": detective 1: What do you think of that? That's my concrete evidence!
dialog.April: It was, like, 9:00 at night. I lo: witness 1: Around 9:00 PM, I happened to look out the window!
dialog.April: And then, oooh! I saw a woman wit: witness 1: And then, wow! I observed a woman with long hair under attack!
dialog.April: The one attacking her was the mou: witness 1: The attacker was the quiet-looking girl seated over there!
dialog.April: Then the woman, like, dodged to o: witness 1: The woman then sort of dodged aside and fled!
dialog.April: But that girl, she caught up to h: witness 1: But the other girl pursued her and... and... struck her!
dialog.April: Then the woman with the long hair: witness 1: Then the woman with the long hair...
dialog.April: The end. That's all I saw. Every: witness 1: That concludes it. That's everything I witnessed!
dialog.April: The victim--the woman--dodged the: witness 1: The victim -- the woman -- evaded the initial attack and fled to the right.
dialog.April: Then the girl in the hippie cloth: witness 1: Then the girl dressed unconventionally pursued her...
dialog.April: And she hit her with that weapon!: witness 1: And struck her with the weapon! I saw it!
dialog.April: That... that clock! Um... the kin: witness 1: That... that clock! Uh... the statue-like clock? E5, I believe?
dialog.April: Well? Does the accuracy of my rep: witness 1: Well? Isn't my report's accuracy surprising?
dialog.Bellboy: I am the head bellboy at the fi: witness 2: I am the head bellboy at the Gatewater Hotel, a four-generation establishment!
dialog.Bellboy: I believe I received a call aft: witness 2: I recall receiving a call after 8 PM from our guest, witness 1.
dialog.Bellboy: She asked for an ice coffee to: witness 2: She requested an iced coffee be delivered exactly at 9:00.
dialog.Bellboy: I brought it to her at precisel: witness 2: Naturally, I delivered it precisely at the specified time.
dialog.Bellboy: And I delivered the ice coffee: witness 2: And I personally delivered the iced coffee to witness 1.
